name: RELC Sports
founded: 2010 (Panama corporate registration) Headquarters : Panama City, Panama (El Cangrejo, Bella Vista district) Players : 29 (23 in 1st tier) – Total market value: €19mm FIFA/FA registration : FIFA-licensed agent – Edgardo Rubén Carles Cal, License ID 202305-1947; registered intermediary with Panamanian FA Languages : Spanish, English Regions covered : Panama, Central America, MLS (USA), Mexico, Ecuador, Russia, Spain, Slovakia, Austria, Ukraine, Honduras, Peru, USA lower leagues, UAE Email : [carlescal@hotmail.com](mailto:carlescal@hotmail.com) Instagram : [https://www.instagram.com/relcsports/](https://www.instagram.com/relcsports/) X : [https://x.com/EdCarles](https://x.com/EdCarles)
about: RELC SPORTS INC. is a Panama City based football agency specialising in representing Panamanian and Central American talent abroad, with a strong focus on connecting players to MLS, Liga MX, South America and selected European leagues. Founded in the early 2010s by FIFA-licensed agent Edgardo Rubén Carles Cal, the agency has grown from a domestic intermediary to a recognised bridge for Panamanian internationals moving overseas. RELC concentrates on professional players rather than academy-age clients, but also follows its prospects from youth national teams into the senior game. Its differentiator is a tight focus on one market – Panama – while building deep relationships with a relatively small but high-impact client list in Mexico, MLS and Europe.

notableDeals: 2025 – Adalberto Carrasquilla from Houston Dynamo (MLS) to UNAM Pumas (Liga MX) on a permanent deal, contract reportedly to 2027 with option for an extra year. - 2024 – Eduardo Guerrero from Zorya Luhansk to Dynamo Kyiv on a permanent transfer around €2.5m, signing until 2029; one of the highest-value outgoing moves for a Panamanian forward to Eastern Europe. - 2024 / 2025 – Omar Valencia from CAI Panamá to New York Red Bulls, with RELC announcing the definitive transfer and a contract through 2027 (plus option). - 2025 – Edgardo Fariña from CAI Panamá / CSD Municipal path to FC Pari Nizhniy Novgorod in the Russian Premier League, securing his first European contract. - 2023–2024 – José Fajardo to CD Universidad Católica in Ecuador’s LigaPro, returning to Ecuadorian football with an option to buy after spells in Peru and MLS. - 2025 – Rafael Mosquera from Plaza Amador to New York Red Bulls, with RELC and the club jointly announcing the permanent move and contract to 2028 (plus option). - 2025 – Edward Cedeño from SD Tarazona (after spells at Potros del Este and Alajuelense) to UD Las Palmas in LaLiga, contract until 2028. - 2023–2024 – Various renewals and domestic moves for Panama internationals such as Fidel Escobar and other LPF-based players, typically involving multi-year contracts. services: RELC Sports Inc. focuses on a relatively compact but high-touch service offering tailored to Panamanian and Central American professionals: - Contract negotiation - International transfers and loans (MLS, Liga MX, LigaPro Ecuador, Europe) - Career planning and club placement strategy - Image rights and basic commercial advisory - Sponsorship approaches and media visibility in Panama and destination markets - Legal support via external law firms in Panama and abroad - Relocation and logistical support for players and families (visas, housing, first weeks on site) - Performance monitoring via match analysis, with frequent on-site visits to clubs like New York Red Bulls, Pumas and Universidad Católica - Mental support through close agent–player relationships and a small, family-style structure
partnerNetwork: Based on publicly visible deals and content, RELC works regularly with: - Clubs in Panama: Plaza Amador, Tauro FC, San Francisco FC, Sporting San Miguelito, CAI Panamá, Potros del Este - Foreign clubs: UNAM Pumas, New York Red Bulls and New York Red Bulls II, Dynamo Kyiv, Universidad Católica (Ecuador), UD Las Palmas, FC Pari Nizhniy Novgorod, Slovan Bratislava, LASK, Deportivo Saprissa, CD Motagua - Academies and camps: collaboration with Negri/Rose Football Camp and youth showcase events in Panama and the US for players like Rafael Mosquera - Media partners: regular presence on Panamanian sports TV and digital outlets around transfers of Carrasquilla, Fajardo, Mosquera and Cedeño - External lawyers, tax advisers and immigration specialists in Panama and destination countries, inferred from the number of cross-border transfers handled

about: MP Management is a Turin -based football agency founded and owned by Italian agent Michele Puglisi , focused on guiding young professionals and established players through the key phases of their careers. The agency has built a strong footprint in Italian football (Serie A, B, C and youth) and increasingly in top European leagues, including the Premier League, Swiss Super League and Ekstraklasa, with a specialisation in developing defenders, wide players and forwards. MP Management combines a dense scouting network in Italy with international partnerships, offering long-term career planning, transfers, renewals and holistic support (on- and off-pitch) for players and their families.

about: SportsMaxi is a São Paulo–based agency founded in 2016 and focused on the management and development of professional football careers, especially Brazilian and dual-national talents with pathways into European clubs. The agency offers full-service support – from career planning and contract negotiation to image management, financial planning and legal advisory – with a team of ex-players and football specialists. Their portfolio ranges from elite first-team players in Ligue 1, LaLiga and the Saudi Pro League to highly rated U20 prospects in Brazil, Portugal and Italy, with a strong track record in moving talents from South America into top European academies and senior squads.

services: SportsMaxi positions itself as a full-service football management agency, with core offerings including: - Career management – long-term career planning, club pathway strategy and day-to-day guidance. - Contract negotiation – handling new deals, extensions and performance-based structures with clubs. - Transfers and loans – structuring domestic and international moves, including cross-border deals between Brazil, Europe and the Middle East. - Image management – media training, press support, social media positioning and sponsorship coordination. - Sponsorship and commercial – brand partnerships aligned with players’ profiles, especially for emerging talents. - Financial planning – basic financial education and partnership with specialist advisors for wealth and tax planning. - Legal advisory – contract review and negotiation, dispute support and general legal assistance via partner law firms. - Post-career planning – early planning of education, business and coaching pathways for senior players.
partnerNetwork: - Clubs: strong working relationships with clubs such as SC Corinthians, São Paulo FC, Flamengo, Grêmio, Athletico Paranaense, Vasco da Gama, PSG, SC Braga, Roma, Bologna, Cádiz CF, Athletic Club, APOEL and various Brazilian youth academies. - Academies & scouts: network across Brazilian youth tournaments, Italian Primavera, Portuguese youth leagues and South American scouting hubs. - Legal & tax partners: external law firms and tax advisors in Brazil and Europe providing contract and tax-optimisation support. - Performance & wellbeing: in-house mental coach and external physio/conditioning contacts coordinated via SportsMaxi staff. - Marketing & media: collaboration with creative and marketing studios for content and social media campaigns promoting the agency and its players.

name: Total Football Agency (TFA)
alsoKnownAs: TFA – Total Football Agency Founded : 2005 Headquarters : São Paulo (Brazil) & Haarlem / Amsterdam (Netherlands) Players : 13 (4 in 1st tier) – total market value approx. €19mm FIFA/FA registration : Licensed football agent / match agent under KNVB (Royal Dutch FA) for founder Richard Mettes Languages : Portuguese, English, Dutch Regions covered : Brazil, Netherlands, Portugal, Poland, UAE, wider Europe & Middle East Email : [tfa@totalfootballagency.com](mailto:tfa@totalfootballagency.com) Instagram : [https://www.instagram.com/totalfootballagency/](https://www.instagram.com/totalfootballagency/) LinkedIn : [https://www.linkedin.com/company/totalfootballagency/](https://www.linkedin.com/company/totalfootballagency/)
about: Total Football Agency (TFA) is a long-running Brazilian–Dutch agency founded by Richard Mettes in 2005, specialising in building career paths from Brazil to European and Middle Eastern clubs. With offices in São Paulo and the Netherlands, TFA focuses on technically gifted players and increasingly on defenders and goalkeepers who can adapt to European football. The agency manages both senior professionals in first divisions (PSV, Al-Jazira, Radomiak Radom, Floriana) and a pipeline of U20/U23 talent at clubs such as Palmeiras, Corinthians, Botafogo and Grêmio Novorizontino. TFA differentiates itself through long-term development, close family relationships and strong use of video analysis and highlight production to position clients for international moves.

services: TFA operates as a full-service football agency, following its own “total football” concept of balancing the player’s technical development, physical preparation and personal life. Main services include: - Career planning and long-term pathway design (Brazil → Europe / Middle East) - Contract negotiation and re-negotiation (salaries, bonuses, buy-out clauses, sell-on structures) - Domestic and international transfers / loans - Image management, media support and social media storytelling (highlights, reels, interviews) - Sponsorship and commercial opportunities for senior players - Relocation support for moves to Europe and the Gulf (housing, language, day-to-day support) - Specialist physical preparation and injury-prevention support through in-house staff - Support with visa, work-permit and regulatory issues via local legal partners
partnerNetwork: - Dutch top-flight ecosystem via PSV and Eredivisie contacts, including Heracles Almelo. - UAE Pro League links through Al-Jazira and Bruno’s emergence as a UAE international. - Brazilian clubs such as Ituano, Palmeiras, Corinthians, Botafogo, Novorizontino and others involved in client pathways. - Central European networks via Radomiak Radom and lower-tier Portuguese clubs in client histories. - External specialists: sports lawyers, tax advisors, physical coaches and video analysts engaged on a case-by-case basis.

about: CA Sport Management Sagl is a Swiss -registered football agency with a strong Italian focus, combining a legal base in Lugano with an operational office and brand presence as CA Sports Management in Muri bei Bern. The agency centers its work around Serie A-level representation (most notably Juventus goalkeeper Michele Di Gregorio) and a tightly curated group of Italian prospects across Juventus, Atalanta, Monza, Como, Renate, Casatese and other clubs. It primarily represents players (from top-flight starters to Primavera and U17 talents) and focuses on long-term career building, contract strategy and carefully planned steps through the Italian system. The CA Sports Management brand emphasizes personal support, career planning and sponsoring/marketing to complement on-pitch development.

Contact: via central agency email (ca.sportsmanagement@hotmail.com). - Licensed agents (selection): Carlo Alberto Belloni – FIGC-registered agent representing clients including Michele Di Gregorio in Serie A transfers (Monza → Juventus). - Ufuk Arslan – Licensed FIFA Football Agent and General Manager of CA Sports Management, overseeing international transfers and contract work for the Swiss office.

notableDeals: 2024 – Michele Di Gregorio – Monza → Juventus FC (Serie A) Permanent transfer, widely reported around the €14m range plus bonuses, with a contract running to 2029. Agent Carlo Alberto Belloni and CA Sport Management Sagl handled the move, with the agent confirming strong Liverpool interest that was ultimately declined to honor a verbal commitment to Juventus. - 2023 – Michele Di Gregorio – Inter → Monza (Serie A) FIGC’s 2023 Serie A transaction report lists CA Sport Management Sagl and Belloni as the agent side when Monza secured Di Gregorio’s rights, consolidating his status as a first-choice Serie A goalkeeper. - 2025 – Filippo Cecchini – Atalanta U23 → Alcione Milano (Serie C, loan) Loan move to Alcione Milano (Serie C – Girone A) from Atalanta U23, framed as a key step for first-team senior minutes; Cecchini remains under Atalanta contract while represented by CA Sport Management Sagl. - 2024 – Luca Amaradio – Juventus Next Gen (contract / extension) Winger signed a multi-year deal with Juventus Next Gen running until 2028, with CA Sport Management Sagl as the listed agent; the player is considered one of the higher-value prospects in the portfolio. - 2024 – Giuseppe Mungari – Atalanta Primavera (internal move and integration) Atalanta integrated Mungari into their Primavera and UEFA U19 squad structure from 2024, with CA Sport Management Sagl managing his representation as a versatile second striker / centre-forward. - 2023–2025 – Youth placements and contracts (various) A series of youth deals and contract signings for talents such as Cristian Mazzara (Como Primavera), Gregorio Perego (Monza U17), Riccardo Guidi and Filippo Viganò (Renate Primavera), and Marco Bragotto / Ludovico Donini (Casatese Merate), all under CA Sport Management Sagl’s representation, helped place their prospects in competitive Serie D, Primavera and U17 environments. Fees shown are indicative estimates (not official).
services: Based on the CA Sports Management site and public materials, the agency offers: - Career planning and pathway design (from academy to first team) - Contract negotiation and re-negotiation (signings, extensions, performance clauses) - Transfers and club changes (domestic Italian and international) - Sponsorship and marketing activation (personal brand, commercial partnerships) - Media positioning and image management - Performance analysis and personal training coordination - Prevention and physical preparation support via external specialists - Market analysis and opportunity scouting across Serie A/B, Serie C and youth levels
partnerNetwork: - Clubs: working relationships evidenced by current clients at Juventus (first team, Next Gen, Primavera/U20), Atalanta (Primavera/UEFA U19), Monza (U17), Como (Primavera), Renate (Primavera), Casatese Merate, Derthona, Sanremese, Ardor Lazzate and Alcione Milano . - Academies & youth structures: Serie A academies (Juventus, Atalanta, Monza, Como) and semi-pro development clubs in northern Italy. - Legal / tax and performance: external lawyers, tax advisors and physical trainers are referenced in their service description but not publicly named, consistent with boutique agency practice.

about: Maxidel Management is a young, fast-growing football agency co-founded by FIFA agent Jean-Martial Lopoh and former Ivory Coast international Max-Alain Gradel. The agency combines European agency experience with deep knowledge of West African football to build secure pathways from African academies to European and Middle Eastern clubs. Based between Abidjan and Paris, Maxidel focuses on highly selected elite and high-potential talents rather than volume, providing a complete, structured support package on and off the pitch.
